reviews.text: The Marriott is a few minutes walk from the rail station and close to Cardiff's pubs and nightlife.
reviews.title: Rugby Weekend in Cardiff Marriott

reviews.text: Good points - the hotel is centrally located - very easy to get to by rail, and the hotel benefits from on site car parking. Very comfortable beds, good sized rooms.
reviews.title: Not as good as I'd expected

reviews.text: Bad points - the room was supposed to be available for a 2pm check in but by 3pm we still had not been able to check in. If you stay at the front of the hotel (facing Mill Lane) on a Fri/Sat night then be prepared for lots of noise until well into the early hours as the hotel is situated opposite a row of popular late night bars and clubs with outside eating/drinking areas.
reviews.title: Great!
Good, centrally located hotel
reviews.text: Issues with cleanliness: there was a pair of someone else's underwear among the 'clean' towels left in our room!

These are not 'huge' issues, and we were given a small discount from the final bill, but the attitude of the duty manager was probably the thing that sticks in my mind the most - he didn't appear interested or sincere when discussing any complaints. On balance, I'd stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my partner and we found it an excellent hotel. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was much larger than we expected. We used the pool and the gym facilities which were really good, the jacuzzi is a must! The breakfast was excellent, good choice of food and the are tea and coffee were constantly refiled by the waitresses.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - amazing food
